events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision that occurred on the morning of April 30th, involving their car and another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under 'Auto Accident' based on the description of the incident and keywords related to a car accident.
A claims agent was assigned promptly to handle the case and guide the insured through the subsequent procedures.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment notification confirming the claim was received and entered into the system for processing.
The insured was asked to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and a copy of the driving license for further assessment.
All requested documents, including detailed accident photos and official reports, were submitted by the insured via the online claims portal.
The claims investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence and contacting relevant parties to verify details of the auto accident.
The investigation concluded with findings that the insured was not at fault, and the reported damages matched the vehicle inspection report.
A settlement offer was proposed based on repair estimates and policy coverage limits, aiming to cover all vehicle damages from the collision.
The insured confirmed satisfaction with the proposed settlement amount and expressed gratitude for the efficient claims handling process.
Following the positive feedback, the claim was officially approved by the underwriting department for payment issuance.
The payment to cover vehicle repairs was disbursed to the insured's bank account as per the approved claim settlement.
The claim file was formally closed after confirmation that the insured received the settlement payment and no further actions were pending.
